result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christine A. Niemann

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christine A. Niemann in court.  Attorney Zachary Caley in court for Christine A. Niemann.  Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  Waiting on blood results. Adjmt granted. Bond continued. TR trails.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment.

10:41 AM  State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Defendant, Christine A Niemann, appeared with Attorney Zachary Caley.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM810/22CT332/22TR4189. Attorney Caley advises the Court that the State is still waiting on receiving blood results from the lab. Attorney Caley is also requesting an adjournment to allow the DE to complete treatment. State does not object. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining balance on the client service fee.

ADDRESS INFO for Christine A. Niemann
Current: 116 Lance Drive, Twin Lakes, WI 53181 United States  (Effective: 07-07-2022)
Prior: 610 Gatewood Dr, Twin Lakes, WI 53181

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Caley.   Clerk HMcBride.  DE's motion for bond modification - reduction of amount and possess/handle alcohol for employment purposes.  State opposes motion.  Court hears argument. Court denies bond motion on both counts. 7/22 FPT rescheduled to 8/10 1030am. Bond continued.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining balance on the client service fee.
Bail/bond hearing on July 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond filed by Zachary Caley

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License or a properly installed and operating IID if required.   If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.

03:11 PM  Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Zachary Caley.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:45 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.. $3000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). rb
and witness list filed by the State
